hits.name: Atri Labs
hits.long_description:
Atri framework is NextJS (or Django) + Webflow. We make it easy for developers to use both code and no-code on the same page in their web apps. 

We launched 3 months ago and we already have 24,000 downloads, 2,400 GitHub stars and were trending as a no. 1 TypeScript repo in December. 

Shyam and I dropped out of our graduate programs at MIT & Columbia University to work on this idea full-time. Previously, we were researchers at MIT AI Lab and US Department of Defense respectively and had built products that generated $10M+/year in revenue.

hits.name: Meru
hits.long_description:
At Meru, we help developers create personalized, in-app content for their users. Our managed cloud brings together many different generative models and model customizations techniques, making them available through a simple set of API calls. We connect siloed or personal data to generative tooling, powering results that carry an understanding of this data. 

We’re working on Meru because it’s a company that will make our lives less mundane. We power use-cases that help professionals escape the drudgery of pouring through long, complex texts searching for a key piece of information. We also power apps that let parents create storybooks where their children are the main character, complete with artwork and illustrations showcasing the child as an astronaut, or superhero — whatever they can dream up.

hits.name: Fern
hits.all_locations: San Francisco, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA
hits.long_description:
Our team has spent a lot of time doing repetitive, boring tasks when writing APIs.

We would write the types and networking on the backend and then do it all again in TypeScript on the frontend. We’d do it again when writing client libraries, and a fourth time when updating our documentation and Postman collection.

Writing the same code again and again and keeping it all in sync is time-consuming, error-prone, and work that no engineering team wants to do.

Fern is automation for your API. Define your API once and click generate. Out of the box, you’ll get server code, clients, and a Postman collection.
hits.one_liner: Automation for your API.

hits.name: Common Paper
hits.long_description:
Common Paper is a contracting platform that helps startups close deals with their customers faster and with less risk.

We create standard, open-source contracts for commercial transactions, including NDAs, DPAs, and sales agreements. These are analogous to the SAFE, but are between customers and vendors rather than investors and startups. The standardized format means that data within contracts is structured from inception. 

We build software for managing standard contracts, accelerating sales cycles, and making the data within the contracts programmatically accessible to other business systems.

Thousands of people have downloaded our standard contracts, and 63% of the contracts on our system close within 24 hours.

hits.name: Baseplate
hits.long_description:
Baseplate is a tool that makes it easy to build high-performance LLM apps. By replacing existing API calls to LLMs with ours, you can automatically start building fine tuning datasets and get actionable insights into your model’s performance

We launched 2 weeks ago and are in the process of finding our first paying customers. We have roughly 20 users on our free plan.

We make money through a subscription model, charging $20 per month, per seat. The generative AI space is growing rapidly and models are being deployed across many industries. Taking into account text, code, images, and more we estimate a market size of around 5,000,000 teams, and market size $1B , growing 30% YoY.

In the process of building our own LLM apps, Andrew and I realized how far behind ML operations tools are for the new wave of ML applications. We couldn’t find the tools we needed, so we’re building them ourselves.

We are Baseplate, thank you.

hits.name: DAGWorks Inc.
hits.long_description:
At DAGWorks Inc. our goal is to change how ML teams are staffed and operate. We’re building an open core SaaS platform to streamline development and operation of ML ETLs in a collaborative, self-service manner, utilizing a company's existing MLOps and data infrastructure.

We believe self-service for Data Practitioners is the future because it enables domain modeling experts the velocity to iterate on ML models without hand-off, which is key for businesses using ML to differentiate themselves. Unless you’re a big tech company or someone like Stitch Fix that can afford a platform team, staffing teams with high ratios of data engineers, or finding unicorn data scientists that can build ML ETLs is your only option; it not only slows time to value for ML, it makes operating ML expensive. 

We’re here to change that. Think simple python that enables a low software engineering bar to describe what should happen, and then with some extra metadata, generates the workflow code and manages integrations with MLOps tools of your choice, all in a self-service manner. It’s functional and usable by junior and senior folks alike.
hits.one_liner: Collaborative ML ETL platform for data scientists

hits.name: Turntable
hits.long_description:
Turntable is an AI-powered toolkit to find, contextualize and transform data.

Despite being one of the most important parts of a modern business, data transformation tools are often hard to use, slow, and uninspiring. Data teams spend the majority of their time finding the right data, creating pipelines, and responding to ad-hoc requests. With the added issue that recruiting data talent is difficult, data pipelines quickly become a bottleneck for product development and business learning.

To start, we’re focused on reducing the time and cost of transforming data within DBT, an open-source data engineering platform. Our DBT copilot enables data teams to do in minutes what they previously could do in hours or days including: generating or modifying DBT code, writing DBT schema and documentation, and sharing DBT models to BI or visualization tools.

In the future, you’ll see us launch more features and integrations to make it easier to find and contextualize data within your analytics codebase and collaborate with your teammates.
hits.one_liner: Transform data at warp speed

Despite being one of the most important parts of a modern business, data transformation tools are often hard to use, slow, and uninspiring. Data teams spend the majority of their time finding the right data, creating pipelines, and responding to ad-hoc requests. With the added issue that recruiting data talent is difficult, data pipelines quickly become a bottleneck for product development and business learning.

To start, we’re focused on reducing the time and cost of transforming data within DBT, an open-source data engineering platform. Our DBT copilot enables data teams to do in minutes what they previously could do in hours or days including: generating or modifying DBT code, writing DBT schema and documentation, and sharing DBT models to BI or visualization tools.

In the future, you’ll see us launch more features and integrations to make it easier to find and contextualize data within your analytics codebase and collaborate with your teammates.

one_liner.value: Transform data at warp speed

Sanvivo builds a multisided platform to enable customers to order medications, get pharmaceutical advice, and book health services at local pharmacies in Europe. Like Doordash for pharmacies.

Pharmacies play a significant role in every decentralized healthcare system. With their well-established infrastructure, they provide essential medications and pharmaceutical consultations ad hoc for every citizen. However, using state-of-the-art e-commerce methods, online mail-order pharmacies take more and more customers away from local pharmacies. hits.long_description:
SPRX simplifies tax credits by automating your accountant.

With our technology, anyone can prepare an R&D Tax Credit accurately and fast. To provide some background, the R&D Credit is often cited as the most complex and audited tax credit in the United States. With that in mind, we set out to create software to achieve two primary objectives:

1. Ensure that any credit computed with our software is exactly what the IRS is asking for in terms of quality.

2. Democratize the ability to perform high quality R&D Credit studies extremely fast.

hits.name: OutSail Shipping
hits.long_description:
The shipping industry uses more than 300 million tons of fossil fuels every year. Fuel represents roughly half the cost of operating a modern cargo ship, in addition to causing about 3% of total global greenhouse emissions and 60,000 pollution-related deaths per year. Contemporary steamship lines have no viable plan to decarbonize. 

In the last twenty years, rising fuel costs and weather forecasting advances have made wind-powered vessels once again the most economical way to move maritime freight. OutSail Shipping will operate a shipping line with built-in-house vessels based on modern, rigid lifting surfaces and battery-electric technology.
hits.one_liner: Wind-Powered Maritime Freight

Compromised employee logins are the biggest cybersecurity risk to any business today - causing over 86% of security breaches.

0pass is an identity platform that allows organizations to enable the most secure login mechanisms available for every login across their entire company.

We replace traditional login methods like passwords with more convenient methods like Windows Hello, TouchID, FaceID, and Yubikeys. Generally these are “passwordless” methods.

Even if your employees fall victim to fraudulent emails - hackers will not be able to break into your company - period. We drive down account takeover and password resets by 96%.

Contact us to explore passwordless login for your business. 
Together, we'll be the start of 0 passwords everywhere.

Middleware is a real-time observability platform for cloud-native, microservices, and distributed apps that brings all the metrics, logs, traces, and events to a single timeline where the dev and ops teams can find and debug the issue faster. 

Middleware offers a wide range of observability from infrastructure monitoring, logs monitoring, application performance monitoring (APM), synthetic monitoring, and real-time alerting solution.

hits.name: Infisical
hits.long_description:
Infisical is an open-source, end-to-end encrypted tool to sync secrets and configs across your team and infrastructure.

Infisical stores your secrets and app configurations and injects them back into your development workflow, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud infrastructure. It comes with secrets versioning, point-in-time recovery, audit logging, automatic secret rotation capabilities and more.
hits.one_liner: Open-source, end-to-end encrypted secret manager for developers

hits.name: Sameday

hits.name: Mogara
hits.long_description:
We’ve created a user flow builder that stays in sync with Figma, so product managers can ditch those stale flow charts they have to manually update.

The Mogara user flow is better product documentation: a single source of truth that enables easy communication across cross-functional teams, while still allowing them to make updates only where they do their work.
